top_comments.comment: Some one watched breaking bad lol

comments_since_last_sample.body: Also I’m thinking this lady is full of it. I mean you trust a company with many strangers you don’t know and you still left the valuables!!!!! That’s like leaving it in your car when you do an oil change 🤦🏻‍♂️ you don’t leave nothing around no matter what. That’s her fault in my book
Don’t leave jewelry loose around the house. Huge safe or safety deposit box only way to be safe
wtf

Lebron says they're being hunted everyday but if you turn on any local news network or take a look at the dozens of security camera footage popping up here on YouTube each day then whether it's rapes, murders, assaults, theft etc then it seems like it everyone else that's being hunted
Some one watched breaking bad lol
0:44 clearly this woman didn't have common sense to know that to secure or take important items with you. Also do they not lock the doors after finishing?
How can we be sure it's not the bugs seeking pro-active revenge for their impending, imminent deaths?
Smart lol
If I was rich i wouldn't have neighbors.

This is a perfect example that there's no personal responsibility anymore, this lady is trying to push the blame instead of having a little common sense and securing her valuable belongings. Has 70 thousand dollars worth of jewelry but can't afford a thousand dollar safe.
The police steal people stuffs too.
If she's not able to stay in the home she should have looked  up her jewelry and not left any valuables in that house!
She would sue the company lmao
That woman who wouldn’t take precautions before her house was tented is clearly an idiot
That closet be nice tho

you shouldn't be told to secure your valuables lol
if you know you'll be away for a few days...take them with you, hide them, or move them somewhere safe.
common sense isn't something that everyone has...
Wtf I just watched that episode of breaking bad today where they cook meth under the tents ! 😂
Come on lady, it’s common sense to lock up your valuables!!
